conclusion: The problem involves finding the refractive index of a liquid in a tank using the principle of similar triangles.
The diagram shows a tank with height H, a light spot at point a on the left wall at a distance h from the bottom, and the light spot on the liquid surface at a distance L from the left wall.

The given information includes the height of the tank (H), the distance between point a and the bottom of the tank (h), and the distance between the light spot on the liquid surface and the left wall of the tank (L).
The principle of similar triangles can be applied to solve the problem.
The triangles aH and Lr are similar because they share the angle at a and have the same height H.
The ratio of the sides of the triangles aH and Lr is h/L.
The refractive index of the liquid, n, is equal to the ratio of the sides of the triangles aH and Lr, which is h/L.
The refractive index of the liquid is n = h/L.
